text: Betty L. Siegel (January 24, 1931 â€“ February 11, 2020) was an American author and educator. He was president of Kennesaw State University. She was the first female president of the University System of Georgia. She was in that position for 25 years, making her the longest serving female president of a state university in the United States from 1981 to 2006. Siegel was born in Cumberland, Kentucky. Siegel died on February 11, 2020 in Kennesaw, Georgia at the age of 89. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Writers from Kentucky Category:Academics from Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Betty Siegel
